sentences.english: It's because of the greenhouse effect, and these islands belong to Maldives.
sentences.chinese: 因为温室效应呗，这些岛屿是属于马尔代夫的。

sentences.chinese: 明星演员是美国宇航局戈达尔太空研究所所长詹姆斯·汉森，他声称有99%的把握，由于人类活动影响的“温室效应”，气温正在上升。

sentences.english: Other schemes entail the placement of giant orbiting mirrors to focus sunlight upon Mars’ polar icecaps, thus releasing liquid water and gaseous carbon dioxide to kick-start a greenhouse effect.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还要在火星轨道放置巨型反光镜，集中太阳光融化火星极地的冰盖，从而释放出液态的水和气态的二氧化碳制造温室效应。

detailed_translations.english: the gradual warming of the air surrounding the Earth as a result of heat being trapped by  pollution

sentences.chinese: 孕期吸烟会危及胎儿生命。

sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生直接落入了保守党布设的圈套。

to trick sb into sth

sentences.chinese: 该地区很有植物学研究价值。

detailed_translations.english: relating to plants or the scientific study of plants

sentences.english: The speaker can extemporize on any of a number of subjects.
sentences.chinese: 该演讲人对若干题目中的任一个都能即席发言。

sentences.chinese: 他们抽调了三艘航空母舰和一些战舰组成一支特遣部队。

sentences.chinese: 管理顾问

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to give advice on a particular subject

sentences.chinese: 啤酒厂在它转型的十年内都将持续对公众开放，所以建筑师希望测试一个施工基地怎样才能用于公共活动。

sentences.chinese: 马勒家族已经在他们位于明斯特的啤酒厂专门从事啤酒酿制达200年之久。

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.chinese: 年轻的囚犯正在被年纪较大、刑期长的犯人带坏。

sentences.chinese: 75%以上的土地用于农耕。

sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

sentences.chinese: 建议顾客提前订座。

sentences.chinese: 我们必须采取行动。

sentences.chinese: 这是否意味着我们能够前进到在我们前面的那些宇宙里去拜访他们？

sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

sentences.chinese: 豹皮上有黑色斑点。

sentences.chinese: 与母亲离散的幼豹很可能被其他的野兽吃掉。

sentences.chinese: 新华社消息，中部省份河南省计划在未来五年内为包括雪豹、猕猴、朱鹮在内的多种濒危野生动物建立繁育基地。

sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.chinese: 我看见过一个大海龟。

sentences.chinese: 像乌龟一样慢慢跑。

sentences.chinese: 无论如何，野兔和乌龟得到什么都是基于它们的行为举止的。

sentences.chinese: 除了海滩上的几个小孩，我们一整天没见到什么人。

sentences.chinese: 除了结局，这部电影真的不错。

sentences.chinese: 我们把拖车挂在汽车尾部。

sentences.chinese: 比如，他们想让我切换到GPL许可协议下，否则他们将认为我违反了他们的许可协议。

sentences.chinese: 这类计划好的断开让应用程序得以结束它们的网络活动并准备好断开网络。

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

sentences.english: He kissed the tip of her nose.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的鼻尖。

sentences.english: gardening tips
sentences.chinese: 园艺小窍门

sentences.english: Did you leave a tip ?
sentences.chinese: 你留小费了吗？

sentences.english: His helmet had tipped forward and the boy pushed it back.
sentences.chinese: 头盔向前耷拉下来，男孩把它往后推了推。

detailed_translations.english: the end of something, especially something pointed
to move into a sloping position, so that one end or side is higher than the other, or to make something do this

sentences.english: That information is not in our possession.
sentences.chinese: 那则信息不归我们所有。

sentences.english: How did the painting come into your possession (= how did you get it ) ?
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是怎么到你手上的？

sentences.english: The finance company now has possession of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。

sentences.english: We didn’t take possession of (= get and start using ) the car until a few days after the auction.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

detailed_translations.english: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

sentences.english: a map and compass
sentences.chinese: 地图和指南针

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that shows directions and has a needle that always points north

sentences.english: Sales staff get a generous mileage allowance or a company car.
sentences.chinese: 销售人员有优厚的里程补贴或者公司提供的专用汽车。

sentences.english: If you are entitled to sickness allowance, you must claim it from your employer.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有资格领取疾病津贴，必须向雇主申请索要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 津贴， 补贴； 零用钱
detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you are given regularly or for a special purpose

sentences.english: If you or your partner criticise each other habitually, you are attacking their personality.
sentences.chinese: 如果你或你的伴侣习惯性地批评对方，其实你们是在攻击对方的人格。

sentences.english: The more we criticise a nation in motion the less we have to say about our own sad lost little island.
sentences.chinese: 我们对运转中的国家的批评越多，我们就能更少地谈到我们所在的迷失的小岛。

sentences.english: These papers found it to their advantage, during the unpopularity of Darling, to criticise severely the acts of that Governor, who was defended by the Gazette with intemperate zeal.
sentences.chinese: 这两份报纸发现，基于达令总督的不得人心，他们拥有一大优势：严词批评总督的法令，和《公报》的过分阿谀拍马对着干。

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

sentences.english: Was she being sarcastic?
sentences.chinese: 她是在嘲讽吗？

detailed_translations.english: saying things that are the opposite of what you mean, in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed

sentences.english: One prisoner was still holding out on the roof of the jail.
sentences.chinese: 一名囚犯仍在监狱的屋顶上拒不投降。

detailed_translations.english: If you hold out, you manage to resist an enemy or opponent in difficult circumstances and refuse to give in

sentences.english: This world is training workers, that there may be no shirkers in the continuous by and by.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界正在训练工人，不久以后，也许不会有持续开小差的人。

detailed_translations.english: presently or eventually

sentences.english: Sofia was intending to call on Miss Kitts.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅打算去拜访基茨小姐。

detailed_translations.english: If you call on someone or call upon someone, you pay them a short visit

sentences.english: I wasn't successful, so they looked down on me.
sentences.chinese: 我并不成功，所以他们瞧不起我。

detailed_translations.english: To look down on someone means to consider that person to be inferior or unimportant, usually when this is not true

sentences.english: The peace agreement came about through intense pressure by the international community.
sentences.chinese: 该和平协议是在国际社会的强大压力下产生的。

sentences.english: That came about when we went to New York last year.
sentences.chinese: 那件事发生在去年我们去纽约时。

detailed_translations.english: When you say how or when something came about, you say how or when it happened

sentences.english: attempts to abolish slavery
sentences.chinese: 废除奴隶制的努力

detailed_translations.english: the system of having slaves

sentences.english: Systems engineering has been widely applied in the oilfield exploitation and construction.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，系统工程学在油田开发建设中应用广泛。

sentences.english: One partial solution to our energy problems lies not in the oilfield but in the cornfield, as nations increasingly replace some petroleum needs with bioenergy — fuel made from plants.
sentences.chinese: 解决能源危机的新出路不在油田，而可能在农田；世界各国正在用生物能源——从植物中提取的燃料——取代对部分石油制品的需求。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land or sea under which there is oil

sentences.english: The trial was held under tight security .
sentences.chinese: 这场审讯是在戒备森严的情况下进行的。

sentences.english: lax security at airline check-in desks
sentences.chinese: 登机手续柜台松懈的安全措施

sentences.english: terrorist activity that is a threat to national security
sentences.chinese: 威胁国家安全的恐怖活动

sentences.english: The prison was ordered to tighten security after a prisoner escaped yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天一名囚犯越狱后，该监狱被勒令加强安全措施。

sentences.english: The Security Commission investigates breaches of security .
sentences.chinese: 安全委员会对违反安全规定的事项进行调查。

sentences.english: We have been asked not to say anything for security reasons .
sentences.chinese: 出于安全考虑，我们被要求守口如瓶。

sentences.english: The security forces opened fire, killing two people.
sentences.chinese: 保安部队开枪打死了两个人。

sentences.english: The thief was caught on a security camera .
sentences.chinese: 小偷被保安摄像机当场拍了下来。

sentences.english: There are strict security checks on everyone entering the Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 每个人进入歌剧院都要接受严格的安全检查。

sentences.english: A large number of homes lack adequate security measures .
sentences.chinese: 许多住宅都未采取足够的安全措施。

detailed_translations.english: things that are done to keep a person, building, or country safe from danger or crime

sentences.english: a story with a happy ending
sentences.chinese: 结局美满的故事

detailed_translations.english: the way that a story, film, activity etc finishes

sentences.english: Our brows went up in surprise.
sentences.chinese: 我们惊奇地竖起了眉毛。

sentences.english: His father stared in surprise and then burst out in tears.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲惊奇地盯着他，然后便泪如泉涌。

sentences.english: You are an impertinent little monkey!' exclaimed Mrs Linton, in surprise.
sentences.chinese: “你是一个胡闹的小猴子！” 林惇夫人惊奇地叫起来。

sentences.english: James broke down and wept.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯控制不住感情，哭了起来。

sentences.english: He wept bitterly (= cried a lot ) when it was time for us to leave.
sentences.chinese: 我们要分别的时候他痛哭了一场。

detailed_translations.english: to cry, especially because you feel very sad

sentences.english: Police shot one suspect when he pulled a gun on them.
sentences.chinese: 警方在一名嫌疑人拔枪指着他们时击毙了他。

sentences.english: Smith killed his wife, and then shot himself.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯杀死妻子，然后开枪自杀。

sentences.english: A woman was shot dead in an attempted robbery.
sentences.chinese: 一名女子在一桩未遂抢劫案中中枪身亡。

sentences.english: The guards have orders to shoot intruders on sight (= shoot them as soon as they see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫兵们奉命一见到有人闯入就开枪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击，射中；拍摄；发芽；使爆炸；给…注射
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately kill or injure someone using a gun
an occasion when someone takes photographs or makes a film

sentences.english: She was found alive but unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 她被找到时还活着，但已不省人事。

detailed_translations.english: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious

sentences.english: He balanced the plate on the top of a pile of books.
sentences.chinese: 他把盘子在一摞书上放稳。

sentences.english: Ma stacked the cups and piled the plates.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈把杯盘堆叠起来。

detailed_translations.english: a group of several things of the same type that are put on top of each other
to arrange things in a pile

sentences.english: Lille is close to the frontier between France and Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 里尔靠近法比边境。

detailed_translations.english: the border of a country

sentences.english: Orders came that we should spade the trench in an hour.
sentences.chinese: 有命令要我们必须在一小时内挖好战壕。

sentences.english: From nine to eleven he planned to dig a hole, or trench, and possibly find something good to eat buried in the dirt.
sentences.chinese: 九点到十一点，他打算挖一个洞，或者一条小沟也行，没准儿还能从脏土里翻出什么好吃的呢。

sentences.english: The bridge lies like a trench in the fortress of the moat, which is shaped to blend in with the outlines of the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 这座桥就像是坐落在护城河中的一条沟渠，这种造型是为了使它与周围的风景融合在一起。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow hole dug into the surface of the ground

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

sentences.english: Belinda greeted her warmly.
sentences.chinese: 贝琳达热情地招呼她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欢迎，迎接；致敬，致意；映入眼帘

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

sentences.english: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.chinese: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

detailed_translations.english: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc

sentences.english: We came in peace for all mankind.
sentences.chinese: 我们代表全人类为和平目的而来。

sentences.english: To live in peace and security and to give our children a better future.
sentences.chinese: 生活在和平与安全之中，并给我们的后代一个更好的未来。

sentences.english: It will come with a new flag raised for a democratic Palestine to live side by side in peace with Israel.
sentences.chinese: 在它降临时，一面新的旗帜会高高升起，象征着民主的巴勒斯坦与以色列和平并存。

sentences.english: My father put all his money into stock market bonds.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。

sentences.english: furious trading on the bond market
sentences.chinese: 债券市场疯狂的交易

sentences.english: the emotional bond between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的感情纽带

detailed_translations.english: an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with interest

sentences.english: In the opening shot, we see Travolta’s feet walking down the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 在开场的镜头中，我们看到特拉沃尔塔的脚在人行道上行走。

detailed_translations.english: the view of something in a film or television programme that is produced by having the camera in a particular position

detailed_translations.chinese: 用尽的；破旧的；杂色的，闪光的
detailed_translations.english: in bad condition because of being used too much or treated badly

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击（shoot的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: the other patients in the ward
sentences.chinese: 病房里的其他病人

detailed_translations.english: a large room in a hospital where people who need medical treatment stay

sentences.english: His hands were badly scarred by the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他的双手被那次大火烧得疤痕累累。

sentences.english: She will probably be scarred for life .
sentences.chinese: 她有可能留下永久的疤痕。

detailed_translations.english: if a wound or cut scars you, it leaves a permanent mark on your body
a permanent mark that is left on your skin after you have had a cut or wound

sentences.english: ...a heart surgeon.
sentences.chinese: …一位心脏外科医生。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor who does operations in a hospital

sentences.english: We put some ointment and a bandage on his knee.
sentences.chinese: 我们在他的膝盖上涂了些药膏，还缠了一条绷带。

sentences.english: The nurse bandaged up his sprained ankle.
sentences.chinese: 护士用绷带包扎他扭伤的脚踝。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow piece of cloth that you tie around a wound or around a part of the body that has been injured
to tie or cover a part of the body with a bandage

sentences.english: The two soldiers saluted Lieutenant Cecil.
sentences.chinese: 那两名士兵向塞西尔中尉行了礼。

sentences.english: The men jumped to their feet and saluted.
sentences.chinese: 这些人赶紧起立敬礼。

detailed_translations.english: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…敬礼，向…致意；赞扬，颂扬
detailed_translations.english: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc
an act of raising your right hand to your head as a sign of respect, usually done by a soldier to an officer

sentences.english: He began sobbing uncontrollably .
sentences.chinese: 他不由自主地抽噎起来。

sentences.english: Her sobs grew louder.
sentences.chinese: 她的呜咽声变得更大了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 啜泣，呜咽；（风等）发出呜咽声
detailed_translations.english: to cry noisily while breathing in short sudden bursts
A sob is one of the noises that you make when you are crying

sentences.english: Remember that you have sworn an oath and so must tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 记住你已经宣过誓了，所以必须讲真话。

sentences.english: Presidents must swear allegiance to the US constitution.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须宣誓效忠美国宪法。

detailed_translations.english: to make a public official promise, especially in a court of law
to use rude and offensive language

sentences.english: She was a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们家在维也纳的一个交情不深的朋友。

sentences.english: They developed an acquaintance over the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 他们在因特网上相识。

sentences.english: The practice of a lawyer requires acquaintance with court procedures.
sentences.chinese: 当律师要熟悉法庭程序。

detailed_translations.english: someone you know, but who is not a close friend

sentences.english: He sailed westward from Palos de la Frontera.
sentences.chinese: 他从帕洛斯·德拉·弗龙特拉港出发向西航行。

sentences.english: ...the one-hour westward flight over the Andes to Lima.
sentences.chinese: …越过安第斯山脉到利马一小时的向西飞行。

detailed_translations.english: Westward or westwards means toward the west
Westward is also an adjective

sentences.english: The boy picked up a handful of stones and started throwing them at us.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩捡起一把石子，开始朝我们扔过来。

sentences.english: There were only a handful of people there.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：那里只有几个人。

detailed_translations.english: an amount that you can hold in your hand

sentences.english: The water tank is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 水箱在漏水。

sentences.english: Somehow the chemical got from a storage tank into water supplies.
sentences.chinese: 不知怎么的，这种化学物从储存箱进入了供水系统。

sentences.english: the plane’s fuel tank
sentences.chinese: 飞机的油箱

detailed_translations.english: a large container for storing liquid or gas

sentences.english: a New Year’s Eve fireworks display
sentences.chinese: 除夕夜的烟火表演

sentences.english: Jeff and David were in the back yard setting off fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 杰夫和戴维在后院放烟花。

detailed_translations.english: a small container filled with powder that burns or explodes to produce coloured lights and noise in the sky

sentences.english: people motivated by jealousy and greed
sentences.chinese: 受妒忌和贪婪驱使的人们

detailed_translations.english: a strong desire for more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

sentences.english: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我们的友谊逐年加深。

sentences.english: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

sentences.english: The company plans to strengthen its hand (= make itself more powerful ) in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

detailed_translations.english: to become stronger or make something stronger

sentences.english: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校，当局还是决定把它关闭。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

sentences.english: the rough draft of his new novel
sentences.chinese: 他的新小说的草稿

sentences.english: I read the first draft and thought it was very good.
sentences.chinese: 我读了第一稿，觉得非常好。

sentences.english: All parties eventually approved the final draft (= finished form ) of the peace treaty.
sentences.chinese: 各方最后都同意了和平条约的终稿。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

sentences.english: She never gets any exercise – she must be really unfit.
sentences.chinese: 她从不锻炼——身体一定很不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不适宜的；不合格的；不健康的
detailed_translations.english: not in a good physical condition

detailed_translations.chinese: 使不合格；使不相宜；使不胜任

sentences.english: spray from the waves
sentences.chinese: 海浪溅起的水雾

sentences.english: a new hair styling spray
sentences.chinese: 一种新的定型喷发剂

sentences.english: Most farmers use pesticide sprays.
sentences.chinese: 大多数农民都使用喷雾杀虫剂。

sentences.english: She sprayed herself with perfume.
sentences.chinese: 她往身上喷了香水。

detailed_translations.english: water in very small drops that is blown from the sea etc or sent up by vehicles on a wet road
to force liquid out of a container so that it comes out in a stream of very small drops and covers an area

sentences.english: They built a dam along the seashore to retain the seawater.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿海岸筑起一道堤坝以拦住海水。

detailed_translations.english: to stop the water in a river or stream from flowing by building a special wall across it
a special wall built across a river or stream to stop the water from flowing, especially in order to make a lake or produce electricity

sentences.english: The tramp from the tram swamped the ham hamburge with shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 有轨电车的脚步声淹没了带有香波的火腿汉堡。

sentences.english: The tramp from the tram swamped the ham hamburger with shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 来自有轨电车的流浪者用洗发水淹没火腿汉堡。

sentences.chinese: 他马上就把这个消息转告给了其他员工。

sentences.chinese: 当时附近没有人可能看见他试图闯进那所房子。

sentences.chinese: 警察在调查镇上发生的一连串暴力强奸案。

sentences.chinese: 她被冤枉在一家服装店里行窃。

sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

sentences.chinese: 很多人认为贝多芬的第五交响曲是他最杰出的作品。

sentences.chinese: 他是个很优秀的选手。

sentences.chinese: 这是个很妙的主意。

sentences.chinese: 哈特菲尔德宅第是英王詹姆斯一世时期建筑的典范。

sentences.chinese: 她被判八年徒刑。

sentences.chinese: 而他基于原则和对自由与真理的热爱所做的选择，使得这种成功永无可能。

sentences.chinese: 即使当克林顿试图与共和党结盟时，如果不同意他们的观点他会在原则上对抗，并从他们的失算中获取政治优势。

sentences.chinese: 他年纪已老，又不得人心，而且他最多也只有两年的政治生命了。

sentences.chinese: 大多数的电脑使用者都没有经过正规的键盘操作训练，因此他们的键盘技巧不够熟练。

sentences.chinese: 这些分子被吸收到血液里，从而影响到器官。

sentences.english: We dropped anchor a few yards offshore.
sentences.chinese: 我们在离岸几码远的地方抛锚停航。

sentences.english: The next morning, they weighed anchor (=  lifted the anchor  ) and began to move south again.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上他们起锚，又开始向南航行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 锚；抛锚停泊；靠山；新闻节目主播
detailed_translations.english: a piece of heavy metal that is lowered to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc to prevent a ship or boat moving
to fasten something firmly so that it cannot move

sentences.english: So the next time you see a chunk of seaweed ... notice the beauty of it, yes.
sentences.chinese: 所以下次你碰见一大片海藻时，要毫不犹豫的欣赏它的美。

sentences.english: The crabs come closer to shore at this time of year, Child said, where they feed on the seaweed.
sentences.chinese: 这些螃蟹每年这个时间，要来到这里海岸的边上，恰尔特说，它们以吃海藻为生。

sentences.english: In many places, like Japan, people get iodine from seafood, seaweed, vegetables grown in iodine-rich soil or animals that eat grass grown in that soil.
sentences.chinese: 像日本等许多地方，人们通过食用海鲜、海藻得到碘，还可以从生长在高碘土壤里的蔬菜或食草动物那里得到碘。

detailed_translations.english: a plant that grows in the sea

sentences.english: Let your arms swing as you walk.
sentences.chinese: 边走边摆动双臂。

sentences.english: a sign swinging in the wind
sentences.chinese: 在风中摇摆的指示牌

sentences.english: He was swinging his bag back and forth .
sentences.chinese: 他前后甩动着他的包。

sentences.english: She swung her legs from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 她左右晃动着两条腿。

sentences.english: She swung her legs from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 他对准球猛地挥拍一击。

detailed_translations.english: to make regular movements forwards and backwards or from one side to another while hanging from a particular point, or to make something do this
a swinging movement or rhythm

sentences.english: Before he learned this, however, he found that moving more than one feather at that speed will spin you like a rifle ball... and Jonathan had flown the first aerobatics of any seagull on earth.
sentences.chinese: 他在学到这一点之前，还发现在那样的速度下，只要转动一两根羽毛就可以像陀螺似地旋转……于是乔纳森成了世界上第一只做特技动作的海鸥。

detailed_translations.english: a large common grey or white bird that lives near the sea

sentences.english: Painting helps fill a spiritual need for beauty.
sentences.chinese: 绘画可以满足对美的精神需求。

sentences.english: spiritual values
sentences.chinese: 精神价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神的， 心灵的； 宗教的
detailed_translations.english: relating to your spirit rather than to your body or mind

sentences.english: Mr White has converted to Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 怀特先生已改信佛教。

sentences.english: The custom derives its origin from Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 这种习惯起源于佛教。

sentences.english: This concept is one of the fundamental doctrines in Buddhism and Hinduism.
sentences.chinese: 这一概念是佛教和印度教最基本的教义之一。

detailed_translations.english: a religion of east and central Asia, based on the teaching of Gautama Buddha

sentences.english: Our thoughts and prayers are with you at this difficult time.
sentences.chinese: 在这艰难时期我们时刻思念你，为你祈祷。

sentences.english: The children said their prayers and got into bed.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们做完祷告后上床睡觉了。

sentences.english: God has answered your prayer .
sentences.chinese: 上帝应许了你的祷告。

sentences.english: the power of prayer
sentences.chinese: 祈祷的力量

detailed_translations.english: words that you say when praying to God or gods

sentences.english: the son of a wealthy merchant
sentences.chinese: 一名富商的儿子

sentences.english: There's been a big reduction in the size of the merchant fleet in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来商船队的数量大为缩减。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and sells goods in large quantities
Merchant seamen or ships are involved in carrying goods for trade

sentences.english: wax crayons
sentences.chinese: 蜡笔

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance made of fat or oil and used to make candles, polish etc
to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

sentences.english: a frying pan
sentences.chinese: 炒锅

sentences.english: pots and pans
sentences.chinese: 锅碗瓢盆

sentences.english: Cook the pasta in a large pan of boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 把意大利面放在一大锅开水里煮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平底锅；盘状的器皿；淘盘子，金盘，秤盘
detailed_translations.english: a round metal container that you use for cooking, usually with one long handle and a lid

detailed_translations.chinese: 淘金；在浅锅中烹调（食物）；[非正式用语]严厉的批评
detailed_translations.english: to wash soil in a metal container in order to separate gold from other substances

sentences.english: They sit cross-legged in a semicircle and share stories.
sentences.chinese: 他们盘着腿围成半圆坐在一起讲故事。

detailed_translations.english: half a circle

sentences.english: They waited in silence and sucked their sweets.
sentences.chinese: 他们静静地等着，吮着糖果。

detailed_translations.english: to take air, liquid etc into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in
an act of sucking
